key_points: Reginald Wood Jr. revealed a letter alleging NYPD and FBI complicity in Malcolm X's assassination.
The letter was written by Raymond A. Wood, an undercover NYPD detective in the 1960s.
Ray Wood's actions allegedly led to the arrest of Malcolm X’s security team members shortly before his assassination.
The letter's public unveiling was supported by civil rights lawyer Ben Crump and Malcolm X's daughters.
Manhattan District Attorney Cyrus Vance Jr. announced a review of the convictions in Malcolm X's killing.
Experts and Ray Wood's daughter have questioned the letter's authenticity and historical accuracy.
Ben Crump emphasized the letter's importance in shedding light on potential injustices in Malcolm X's assassination.
Reggie Wood released the letter to fulfill his cousin's dying wish and seeks justice for Malcolm X and his family.
There has been public skepticism and personal stress for Reggie Wood since revealing the letter.
Ray Wood had a history of infiltrating civil rights groups under NYPD's Bureau of Special Services (BOSSI).
spokespersons: Ron Baldwin (Business Associate, Authorized to Speak on Behalf of Ilyasah Shabazz)
David Viola (Adjunct History Professor, John Jay College of Criminal Justice)
